revised_title: Surface Layer of Polished Silica and Glass: Further Studies on Optical Contact
tldr: The author investigates the surface layer of polished silica and glass and its optical properties. They discover that the highly reflecting layer is unaffected by various treatments, but can be removed using dilute hydrofluoric acid. The author also examines the conditions for producing a highly reflecting layer and its properties, such as its resistance to various treatments.
